tool.name: ITD Detect
tool.description: Detect ITD events in a BAM file.
tool.command:
ln -s '${input}' input.bam && samtools index input.bam && python $__tool_directory__/itd_detect.py --sam input.bam
#if $target: #for $input in $target: #if $input: --target "${input}" #end if #end for #end if
--sample_id '${sample_id}' #if $reference_source.reference_source_selector != "no_ref" #if $reference_source.reference_source_selector != "history" --ref ${reference_source.reference_sequence.fields.path} #else --ref ${reference_source.reference_sequence} #end if #end if #if $paired --paired #end if #if $chr_prefix --chr_prefix #end if #if $min_size --min_size $min_size #end if --outfile '${outfile}' --outfile_vcf '${outfile_vcf}'

param.name: reference_source_selector
param.label: Choose the source for the reference list

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: sample_id
param.label: Sample ID
param.help: Sample ID to be added to the VCF.

param.name: paired
param.label: Paired-end?
param.help: Check if the BAM is paired-end.

param.name: chr_prefix
param.label: Add chr prefix to contigs?
param.help: Check if you need the targets to be prefixed with chr.

param.name: min_size
param.label: Minimum Size
param.help: Minimum ITD size to write to VCF.

tool.help: Detect ITD events in a BAM file. Can be run as either single-end or paired-end. Best results will be obtained if the reads are fully pre-processed in the same manner as your processing pipeline. If starting from raw FASTQ files with no processing pipeline, the suggestion is to run PEAR to merge the reads, then align with BWA and sort/BAMify with Picard or Samtools.
